description.narrative:
The project will empower secondary school students with civic education through mock elections as a tool to enhance their civic participation in Kampala district.
The project will be implemented in one division of Kampala i.e. Nakawa division targeting 3 secondary schools for a period of 12 months. The project will identify a girls# school to work with to ensure gender equality and also will identify a school for young persons with disabilities to ensure disability inclusion and mainstreaming. The remaining one schools will be a mixed school that is; with both girls and boys, those with and those without disabilities. This project will explore new dynamic ways to introduce students to the concepts of citizenship in the earliest pre-voting eligible age through mock elections.
The Mock Election will take on the format of #an election organized for educational or transformative purposes#. Mock elections will be organized by secondary schools to introduce young people to the different ideals and conceptions of democracy before they become eligible to vote. The elections will be designed to give the students a better understanding of democratic institutions like local government, electoral commission, police among others and help prepare them for their role as voters and potential political candidates. The project will be a non-partisan and educational aimed at teaching students to be informed voters. Nearly 500 students will have voted and expressed interest in voting in the annual Mock Election forthe duration of the project cycle. The project design will be adopted from the country#s national voting system and procedures where Students will vote on real ballot measures, on real candidates, and on real paper in the Mock Election.

participating-org.narrative:
Sensitise Uganda with our slogan #illuminating Ugandans for development and positive transformation# is an indigenous/local, national Non Governmental Organization (NGO) whose tremendous aim was to sensitise, build capacity, raise awareness, implement projects and programs to all Ugandans aimed at enhancing socio-economic and political development of individuals, communities and the country as a whole.
Sensitise Uganda was founded on the 15th day of February-2013 but was formally registered on 14th February 2014 with theGovernment of the Republic of Uganda (Ministry of Internal Affairs-NGO board) under the Non-Governmental Organizations RegistrationAct, Cap. 113 with registration Number 10407. Sensitise Uganda was re-registered on 7th September 2019under the Non-Governmental Organizations Act 2016 and was issued a registration certificate with Registration Number INDR107872891NB and also issued an operationlicense Number INDP104072891NB under file Number MIA/NB/2013/11/2891.
The day to day activities of Sensitise Uganda are run by thesecretariat which is headed by the Executive Director and supervised by the Board of Directors of Sensitise Uganda. Sensitise Uganda headquarters apparently are located at Plot 106 Nsubuga Road, Off Kisaasi-KyanjaRoad, Nakawa Division, Kampala City in Uganda. Allthe members of Sensitise Uganda are non-partisan. Sensitise Uganda is a youth led and youth focused and covers the whole of Uganda.
With partners we have been able to achieve a number of things to improve the lives of men, women, girls and boys suffering from poverty, injustice, insecurity and exclusion. We were able to consult young people in Uganda and we developed the National Youth Manifesto 2016-2021: The National Youth Manifesto is a set of policydemands by young Ugandans calling on government and candidates to make the best possible contributions to the development of the country. It sets priority demands that call on government to harness thepotential of the youth to benefit from available opportunities. It provides an opportunity to the country to adopt a youth-led approach to development to achieve the national vision #A transformed Ugandan society from a peasant to a modern and prosperous country within 30 years. The manifesto is hinged offive key thematic areas of employment, health, education, youth participation in decisionmaking and sports and creative arts. Through advocacy while using the national youth manifesto, a lot has been achieved though moreis needed. Unemployment has somehow reduced due to introduction of skills training, the health of Uganda people has improve, the education curriculum has been revised to address the mismatch between the jobs available and the skills acquired.
We have contributedto the review of different laws; Case in point in the Kampala Capital City Authority (KCCA Act), the law that governs the capital city of Uganda Kampala. Formerly it was not recognising youth structures and therefore youth structures could not benefit meaningfully from theKCCAservices, through our advocacy the law was amended and now among other good amendments, youth are recognised within the KCCA Act 2019 as amended.
We facilitated and contributed to the review of the Disability Amendment Bill where we hired a consultantto analyse the law to find the missing links which were presented to parliament with consultations from the Disabled People#s Organisations (DPOs). We are currently involved in the review of the Sexual Offences Bill 2019 which is before the parliamentofthe republic of Uganda.
We were able to train over 300 youth leaders in the national Youth Council in the districts of Kampala, Hoima, Kasese, Ntungamo, Isingiro, Kabale among others to understand their leadership roles and how they can be able to influence government policies and positions to be pro-youth.
We have been able on an annual basis to influence the national budget process to make sure theissues of the marginalised especial youth and women are well captured and financed.
We arecurrentlyamong other activities and efforts implementing the national youth manifesto to be incorporated into the local government planning processes so that all issues of youth in the manifesto are financed and implemented.
The Vision: An informed, coherent, sensitized, transformed and a developed Uganda.
Mission Statement: To sensitise, raise awareness, build capacity of Ugandans on socio-economic and political challenges through implementing projects and programs.
